EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to the green analog channel.

EnumEntry.Name: AnalogBlue
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to the blue analog channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to the blue analog channel.

EnumEntry.Name: AnalogY
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to Y analog channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to Y analog channel.

EnumEntry.Name: AnalogU
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to U analog channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to U analog channel.

EnumEntry.Name: AnalogV
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to V analog channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to V analog channel.

EnumEntry.Name: AnalogTap1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Analog gain will be applied to Tap 1.
EnumEntry.Description: Analog gain will be applied to Tap 1.

EnumEntry.Name: AnalogTap2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Analog gain will be applied to Tap 2.
EnumEntry.Description: Analog gain will be applied to Tap 2.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalAll
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to all digital channels or taps.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to all digital channels or taps.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalRed
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to the red digital channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to the red digital channel.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalGreen
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to the green digital channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to the green digital channel.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalBlue
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to the blue digital channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to the blue digital channel.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalY
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to Y digital channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to Y digital channel.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalU
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to U digital channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to U digital channel.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalV
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to V digital channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to V digital channel.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalTap1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Digital gain will be applied to Tap 1.
EnumEntry.Description: Digital gain will be applied to Tap 1.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalTap2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Digital gain will be applied to Tap 2.
EnumEntry.Description: Digital gain will be applied to Tap 2.

Float.Name: Gain
Float.ToolTip: Controls the selected gain as an absolute physical value.
Float.Description: Controls the selected gain as an absolute physical value. This is an amplification factor applied to the video signal.

Enumeration.Name: GainAuto
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the automatic gain control (AGC) mode.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the automatic gain control (AGC) mode. The exact algorithm used to implement AGC is device-specific.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain is User controlled using Gain.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain is User controlled using Gain.

EnumEntry.Name: Once
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain is automatically adjusted once by the device.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain is automatically adjusted once by the device. Once it has converged, it automatically returns to the Off state.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain is constantly adjusted by the device.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain is constantly adjusted by the device.

Enumeration.Name: GainAutoBalance
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the mode for automatic gain balancing between the sensor color channels or taps.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the mode for automatic gain balancing between the sensor color channels or taps. The gain coefficients of each channel or tap are adjusted so they are matched.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain tap balancing is user controlled using Gain .
EnumEntry.Description: Gain tap balancing is user controlled using Gain .

EnumEntry.Name: Once
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain tap balancing is automatically adjusted once by the device.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain tap balancing is automatically adjusted once by the device. Once it has converged, it automatically returns to the Off state.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain tap balancing is constantly adjusted by the device.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain tap balancing is constantly adjusted by the device.

Enumeration.Name: BlackLevelSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Black Level is controlled by the various Black Level features.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Black Level is controlled by the various Black Level features.

EnumEntry.Name: All
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Black Level will be applied to all channels or taps.
EnumEntry.Description: Black Level will be applied to all channels or taps.

EnumEntry.Name: Red
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Black Level will be applied to the red channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Black Level will be applied to the red channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Green
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Black Level will be applied to the green channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Black Level will be applied to the green channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Blue
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Black Level will be applied to the blue channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Black Level will be applied to the blue channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Y
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Black Level will be applied to Y channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Black Level will be applied to Y channel.

EnumEntry.Name: U
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Black Level will be applied to U channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Black Level will be applied to U channel.

EnumEntry.Name: V
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Black Level will be applied to V channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Black Level will be applied to V channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Tap1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Black Level will be applied to Tap 1.
EnumEntry.Description: Black Level will be applied to Tap 1.

EnumEntry.Name: Tap2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Black Level will be applied to Tap 2.
EnumEntry.Description: Black Level will be applied to Tap 2.

Float.Name: BlackLevel
Float.ToolTip: Controls the analog black level as an absolute physical value.
Float.Description: Controls the analog black level as an absolute physical value. This represents a DC offset applied to the video signal.

Enumeration.Name: BlackLevelAuto
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the mode for automatic black level adjustment.
Enumeration.Description: Controls the mode for automatic black level adjustment. The exact algorithm used to implement this adjustment is device-specific.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Analog black level is user controlled using BlackLevel.
EnumEntry.Description: Analog black level is user controlled using BlackLevel.

EnumEntry.Name: Once
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Analog black level is automatically adjusted once by the device.
EnumEntry.Description: Analog black level is automatically adjusted once by the device. Once it has converged, it automatically returns to the Off state.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Analog black level is constantly adjusted by the device.
EnumEntry.Description: Analog black level is constantly adjusted by the device.

Enumeration.Name: BlackLevelAutoBalance
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the mode for automatic black level balancing between the sensor color channels or taps.
Enumeration.Description: Controls the mode for automatic black level balancing between the sensor color channels or taps. The black level coefficients of each channel are adjusted so they are matched.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Black level tap balancing is user controlled using BlackLevel.
EnumEntry.Description: Black level tap balancing is user controlled using BlackLevel.

EnumEntry.Name: Once
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Black level tap balancing is automatically adjusted once by the device.
EnumEntry.Description: Black level tap balancing is automatically adjusted once by the device. Once it has converged, it automatically returns to the Off state.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Black level tap balancing is constantly adjusted by the device.
EnumEntry.Description: Black level tap balancing is constantly adjusted by the device.

Enumeration.Name: WhiteClipSelector

Enumeration.Description: Selects which White Clip to control.

EnumEntry.ToolTip: White Clip will be applied to all channels or taps.
EnumEntry.Description: White Clip will be applied to all channels or taps.

EnumEntry.Name: Red
EnumEntry.ToolTip: White Clip will be applied to the red channel.
EnumEntry.Description: White Clip will be applied to the red channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Green

EnumEntry.Description: White Clip will be applied to U channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Tap2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: White Clip will be applied to Tap 2.
EnumEntry.Description: White Clip will be applied to Tap 2.

Float.Name: WhiteClip
Float.ToolTip: Controls the maximal intensity taken by the video signal before being clipped as an absolute physical value.
Float.Description: Controls the maximal intensity taken by the video signal before being clipped as an absolute physical value. The video signal will never exceed the white clipping point: it will saturate at that level.

Enumeration.Name: BalanceRatioSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Balance ratio to control.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Balance ratio to control.

EnumEntry.Name: All
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Balance Ratio will be applied to all channels or taps.
EnumEntry.Description: Balance Ratio will be applied to all channels or taps.

EnumEntry.Name: Red
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Balance Ratio will be applied to the red channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Balance Ratio will be applied to the red channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Green
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Balance Ratio will be applied to the green channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Balance Ratio will be applied to the green channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Blue
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Balance Ratio will be applied to the blue channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Balance Ratio will be applied to the blue channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Y
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Balance Ratio will be applied to Y channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Balance Ratio will be applied to Y channel.

EnumEntry.Name: U
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Balance Ratio will be applied to U channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Balance Ratio will be applied to U channel.

EnumEntry.Name: V
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Balance Ratio will be applied to V channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Balance Ratio will be applied to V channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Tap1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Balance Ratio will be applied to Tap 1.
EnumEntry.Description: Balance Ratio will be applied to Tap 1.

EnumEntry.Name: Tap2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Balance Ratio will be applied to Tap 2.
EnumEntry.Description: Balance Ratio will be applied to Tap 2.

Float.Name: BalanceRatio
Float.ToolTip: Controls ratio of the selected color component to a reference color component.
Float.Description: Controls ratio of the selected color component to a reference color component. It is used for white balancing.

Enumeration.Name: BalanceWhiteAuto
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the mode for automatic white balancing between the color channels.
Enumeration.Description: Controls the mode for automatic white balancing between the color channels. The white balancing ratios are automatically adjusted.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: White balancing is user controlled using BalanceRatioSelector and BalanceRatio.
EnumEntry.Description: White balancing is user controlled using BalanceRatioSelector and BalanceRatio.

EnumEntry.Name: Once
EnumEntry.ToolTip: White balancing is automatically adjusted once by the device.
EnumEntry.Description: White balancing is automatically adjusted once by the device. Once it has converged, it automatically returns to the Off state.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: White balancing is constantly adjusted by the device.
EnumEntry.Description: White balancing is constantly adjusted by the device.

Float.Name: Gamma
Float.ToolTip: Controls the gamma correction of pixel intensity.
Float.Description: Controls the gamma correction of pixel intensity. This is typically used to compensate for non-linearity of the display system (such as CRT).

Enumeration.Name: LUTSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which LUT to control.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which LUT to control.

Boolean.Name: LUTEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Activates the selected LUT.
Boolean.Description: Activates the selected LUT.

Integer.Name: LUTIndex
Integer.ToolTip: Control the index (offset) of the coefficient to access in the selected LUT.
Integer.Description: Control the index (offset) of the coefficient to access in the selected LUT.

Integer.Name: LUTValue
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the Value at entry LUTIndex of the LUT selected by LUTSelector.
Integer.Description: Returns the Value at entry LUTIndex of the LUT selected by LUTSelector.

Register.Name: LUTValueAll
Register.ToolTip: Accesses all the LUT coefficients in a single access without using individual LUTIndex.
Register.Description: Accesses all the LUT coefficients in a single access without using individual LUTIndex.

Enumeration.Name: ColorTransformationSelector

Float.Description: Represents the value of the selected Gain factor or Offset inside the Transformation matrix.

Command.Name: CounterReset
Command.ToolTip: Does a software reset of the selected Counter and starts it.
Command.Description: Does a software reset of the selected Counter and starts it. The counter starts counting events immediately after the reset unless a Counter trigger is active. CounterReset can be used to reset the Counter independently from the CounterResetSource. To disable the counter temporarily, set CounterEventSource to Off.

Integer.Name: CounterValue
Integer.ToolTip: Reads or writes the current value of the selected Counter.
Integer.Description: Reads or writes the current value of the selected Counter.

Integer.Name: CounterValueAtReset
Integer.ToolTip: Reads the value of the selected Counter when it was reset by a trigger or by an explicit CounterReset command.
Integer.Description: Reads the value of the selected Counter when it was reset by a trigger or by an explicit CounterReset command.

Integer.Name: CounterDuration
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the duration (or number of events) before the CounterEnd event is generated.
Integer.Description: Sets the duration (or number of events) before the CounterEnd event is generated.

Enumeration.ToolTip: Returns the current status of the Counter.
Enumeration.Description: Returns the current status of the Counter.

EnumEntry.ToolTip: Counts as long as the selected trigger signal level is High.
EnumEntry.Description: Counts as long as the selected trigger signal level is High.

EnumEntry.Name: LevelLow
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Counts as long as the selected trigger signal level is Low.
EnumEntry.Description: Counts as long as the selected trigger signal level is Low.

Float.Name: TimerTriggerArmDelay
Float.ToolTip: Sets the minimum period between two valid timer triggers.
Float.Description: Sets the minimum period between two valid timer triggers.

Enumeration.Name: EncoderSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Encoder to configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Encoder to configure.

Enumeration.Name: EncoderSourceA
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the signal which will be the source of the A input of the Encoder.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the signal which will be the source of the A input of the Encoder.

EnumEntry.Name: Line0
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Encoder Forward input is taken from the chosen I/O Line.
EnumEntry.Description: Encoder Forward input is taken from the chosen I/O Line.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Encoder Forward input is taken from the chosen I/O Line.
EnumEntry.Description: Encoder Forward input is taken from the chosen I/O Line.

EnumEntry.Name: Line2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Encoder Forward input is taken from the chosen I/O Line.
EnumEntry.Description: Encoder Forward input is taken from the chosen I/O Line.

Enumeration.Name: EncoderSourceB
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the signal which will be the source of the B input of the Encoder.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the signal which will be the source of the B input of the Encoder.

EnumEntry.Name: Line0
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Encoder Reverse input is taken from the chosen I/O Line.
EnumEntry.Description: Encoder Reverse input is taken from the chosen I/O Line.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Encoder Reverse input is taken from the chosen I/O Line.
EnumEntry.Description: Encoder Reverse input is taken from the chosen I/O Line.

EnumEntry.Name: Line2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Encoder Reverse input is taken from the chosen I/O Line.
EnumEntry.Description: Encoder Reverse input is taken from the chosen I/O Line.

Enumeration.Name: EncoderMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects if the count of encoder uses FourPhase mode with jitter filtering or the HighResolution mode without jitter filtering.
Enumeration.Description: Selects if the count of encoder uses FourPhase mode with jitter filtering or the HighResolution mode without jitter filtering.

EnumEntry.Name: FourPhase
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The counter increments or decrements 1 for every full quadrature cycle with jitter filtering.
EnumEntry.Description: The counter increments or decrements 1 for every full quadrature cycle with jitter filtering.

EnumEntry.Name: HighResolution
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The counter increments or decrements every quadrature phase for high resolution counting, but without jitter filtering.
EnumEntry.Description: The counter increments or decrements every quadrature phase for high resolution counting, but without jitter filtering.

Integer.Name: EncoderDivider
Integer.ToolTip: Sets how many Encoder increments/decrements are needed to generate an Encoder output pulse signal.
Integer.Description: Sets how many Encoder increments/decrements are needed to generate an Encoder output pulse signal.

Enumeration.Name: EncoderOutputMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the conditions for the Encoder interface to generate a valid Encoder output signal.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the conditions for the Encoder interface to generate a valid Encoder output signal.

EnumEntry.Name: PositionUp
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Output pulses are generated at all new positions in the positive direction.
EnumEntry.Description: Output pulses are generated at all new positions in the positive direction. If the encoder reverses no output pulse are generated until it has again passed the position where the reversal started.

EnumEntry.Name: PositionDown
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Output pulses are generated at all new positions in the negative direction.
EnumEntry.Description: Output pulses are generated at all new positions in the negative direction. If the encoder reverses no output pulse are generated until it has again passed the position where the reversal started.

EnumEntry.Name: DirectionUp
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Output pulses are generated at all position increments in the positive direction while ignoring negative direction motion.
EnumEntry.Description: Output pulses are generated at all position increments in the positive direction while ignoring negative direction motion.

EnumEntry.Name: DirectionDown
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Output pulses are generated at all position increments in the negative direction while ignoring positive direction motion.
EnumEntry.Description: Output pulses are generated at all position increments in the negative direction while ignoring positive direction motion.

EnumEntry.Name: Motion
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Output pulses are generated at all motion increments in both directions.
EnumEntry.Description: Output pulses are generated at all motion increments in both directions.

Enumeration.Name: EncoderStatus
Enumeration.ToolTip: Returns the motion status of the encoder.
Enumeration.Description: Returns the motion status of the encoder.

EnumEntry.Name: EncoderStatic
EnumEntry.ToolTip: No motion within the EncoderTimeout time.
EnumEntry.Description: No motion within the EncoderTimeout time.

Float.Name: EncoderTimeout
Float.ToolTip: Sets the maximum time interval between encoder counter increments before the status turns to static.
Float.Description: Sets the maximum time interval between encoder counter increments before the status turns to static.

Enumeration.Name: EncoderResetSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the signals that will be the source to reset the Encoder.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the signals that will be the source to reset the Encoder.

EnumEntry.Name: FallingEdge

EnumEntry.Description: Resets the Encoder on the Falling Edge of the signal.

EnumEntry.Name: LevelHigh

Command.Name: EncoderReset
Command.ToolTip: Does a software reset of the selected Encoder and starts it.
Command.Description: Does a software reset of the selected Encoder and starts it. The Encoder starts counting events immediately after the reset. EncoderReset can be used to reset the Encoder independently from the EncoderResetSource.

Integer.Name: EncoderValue
Integer.ToolTip: Reads or writes the current value of the position counter of the selected Encoder.
Integer.Description: Reads or writes the current value of the position counter of the selected Encoder.

Integer.Name: EncoderValueAtReset
Integer.ToolTip: Reads the value of the of the position counter of the selected Encoder when it was reset by a signal or by an explicit EncoderReset command.
Integer.Description: Reads the value of the of the position counter of the selected Encoder when it was reset by a signal or by an explicit EncoderReset command.

Float.ToolTip: Defines the resolution of one encoder step.
Float.Description: Defines the resolution of one encoder step.

Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the Logic Block to configure.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the Logic Block to configure.

Enumeration.Name: LogicBlockFunction

Enumeration.Description: Selects the combinational logic Function of the Logic Block to configure.

EnumEntry.Name: AND
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a Logic Block that does the logical AND of all the inputs.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a Logic Block that does the logical AND of all the inputs.

EnumEntry.Name: OR
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a Logic Block that does the logical OR of all the inputs.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a Logic Block that does the logical OR of all the inputs.

EnumEntry.Name: LUT
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a Logic Block that does a Look Up Table Transformation on all the inputs.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a Logic Block that does a Look Up Table Transformation on all the inputs.

EnumEntry.Name: LatchedLUT
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a Logic Block with 2 LUTs as inputs to a Flip-Flop.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a Logic Block with 2 LUTs as inputs to a Flip-Flop.

Integer.Name: LogicBlockInputNumber

Integer.Description: Specifies the number of active signal inputs of the Logic Block.

EnumEntry.Name: False
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Logic Block input is forced to Zero.

Boolean.Name: LogicBlockInputInverter
Boolean.ToolTip: Selects if the selected Logic Block Input source signal is inverted.
Boolean.Description: Selects if the selected Logic Block Input source signal is inverted. This feature is not available when the LogicBlockInputSource is set to True or False.

Integer.Name: LogicBlockLUTIndex
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the index of the truth table to access in the selected LUT.
Integer.Description: Controls the index of the truth table to access in the selected LUT.

Boolean.Name: LogicBlockLUTValue
Boolean.ToolTip: Read or Write the Value associated with the entry at index LogicBlockLUTIndex of the selected LUT.
Boolean.Description: Read or Write the Value associated with the entry at index LogicBlockLUTIndex of the selected LUT.

Integer.Name: LogicBlockLUTValueAll
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the values of all the output bits of the selected LUT in one access ignoring LogicBlockLUTIndex.
Integer.Description: Sets the values of all the output bits of the selected LUT in one access ignoring LogicBlockLUTIndex. LogicBlockLUTValueAll value can be any binary number and each bit correspond to the output value for the corresponding index (i.e. Bit 0 = LUT Index 0 output binary value).

Enumeration.Name: LogicBlockLUTSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which of the two LUTs to configure when the selected Logic Block is a Latched dual LUTs (i.e: LogicalBlockFunction = LatchedLUT).
Enumeration.Description: Selects which of the two LUTs to configure when the selected Logic Block is a Latched dual LUTs (i.e: LogicalBlockFunction = LatchedLUT).

EnumEntry.Name: Value
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the LUT controlling the data input of the flip-flop.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects the LUT controlling the data input of the flip-flop.

EnumEntry.Name: Enable
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the LUT controlling the enable input of the flip-flop.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects the LUT controlling the enable input of the flip-flop.

Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Software Signal features to control.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Software Signal features to control.

EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the software generated signal to control.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects the software generated signal to control.

EnumEntry.Name: SoftwareSignal1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the software generated signal to control.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects the software generated signal to control.

EnumEntry.Name: SoftwareSignal2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the software generated signal to control.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects the software generated signal to control.

Command.Name: SoftwareSignalPulse
Command.ToolTip: Generates a pulse signal that can be used as a software trigger.
Command.Description: Generates a pulse signal that can be used as a software trigger. This command can be used to trigger other modules that accept a SoftwareSignal as trigger source.

Enumeration.Name: ActionUnconditionalMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Enables the unconditional action command mode where action commands are processed even when the primary control channel is closed.
Enumeration.Description: Enables the unconditional action command mode where action commands are processed even when the primary control channel is closed.

Integer.Name: ActionDeviceKey
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the device key that allows the device to check the validity of action commands.
Integer.Description: Provides the device key that allows the device to check the validity of action commands. The device internal assertion of an action signal is only authorized if the ActionDeviceKey and the action device key value in the protocol message are equal.

Integer.Name: ActionQueueSize
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the size of the scheduled action commands queue.
Integer.Description: Indicates the size of the scheduled action commands queue. This number represents the maximum number of scheduled action commands that can be pending at a given point in time.

Integer.Name: ActionSelector
Integer.ToolTip: Selects to which Action Signal further Action settings apply.
Integer.Description: Selects to which Action Signal further Action settings apply.

Integer.Name: ActionGroupMask
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the mask that the device will use to validate the action on reception of the action protocol message.
Integer.Description: Provides the mask that the device will use to validate the action on reception of the action protocol message.

Integer.Name: ActionGroupKey
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the key that the device will use to validate the action on reception of the action protocol message.
Integer.Description: Provides the key that the device will use to validate the action on reception of the action protocol message.

Enumeration.Name: EventSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Event to signal to the host application.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Event to signal to the host application.

EnumEntry.Name: LineTrigger
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just received a trigger to start the capture of one Line.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just received a trigger to start the capture of one Line.

EnumEntry.Name: LineTriggerMissed
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just missed a trigger to start the capture of one Line.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just missed a trigger to start the capture of one Line.

EnumEntry.Name: LineStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just started the capture of one Line.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just started the capture of one Line.

EnumEntry.Name: LineEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just completed the capture of one Line.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just completed the capture of one Line.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just started the exposure of one Frame (or Line).
EnumEntry.Description: Device just started the exposure of one Frame (or Line).

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just completed the exposure of one Frame (or Line).
EnumEntry.Description: Device just completed the exposure of one Frame (or Line).

EnumEntry.Name: Stream0TransferStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just started the transfer of one or many Blocks.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just started the transfer of one or many Blocks.

EnumEntry.Name: Stream0TransferEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just completed the transfer of one or many Blocks.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just completed the transfer of one or many Blocks.

EnumEntry.Name: Stream0TransferBlockStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just started the transfer of one Block.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just started the transfer of one Block.

EnumEntry.Name: Stream0TransferBlockEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just completed the transfer of one Block.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just completed the transfer of one Block.

EnumEntry.Name: Stream0TransferBlockTrigger
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just received a trigger to start the transfer of one Block.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just received a trigger to start the transfer of one Block.

EnumEntry.Name: Stream0TransferBurstStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just started the transfer of a burst of Blocks.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just started the transfer of a burst of Blocks.

EnumEntry.Name: Stream0TransferBurstEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just completed the transfer of a burst of Blocks.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just completed the transfer of a burst of Blocks.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter0Start
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when counter 0 starts counting.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when counter 0 starts counting.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1Start
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when counter 1 starts counting.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when counter 1 starts counting.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter0End
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when counter 0 ends counting.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when counter 0 ends counting.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1End
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when counter 1 ends counting.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when counter 1 ends counting.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer0Start
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when Timer 0 starts counting.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when Timer 0 starts counting.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1Start
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when Timer 1 starts counting.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when Timer 1 starts counting.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer0End
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when Timer 0 ends counting.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when Timer 0 ends counting.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1End
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when Timer 1 ends counting.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when Timer 1 ends counting.

EnumEntry.Name: Encoder0Stopped
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when the Encoder 0 stops for longer than EncoderTimeout.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when the Encoder 0 stops for longer than EncoderTimeout.

EnumEntry.Name: Encoder1Stopped
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when the Encoder 1 stops for longer than EncoderTimeout.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when the Encoder 1 stops for longer than EncoderTimeout.

EnumEntry.Name: Encoder0Restarted
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when the Encoder 0 restarts moving.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when the Encoder 0 restarts moving.

EnumEntry.Name: Encoder1Restarted
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when the Encoder 1 restarts moving.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when the Encoder 1 restarts moving.

EnumEntry.Name: Line0RisingEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when a Rising Edge is detected on the Line 0.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when a Rising Edge is detected on the Line 0.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1RisingEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when a Rising Edge is detected on the Line 1.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when a Rising Edge is detected on the Line 1.

EnumEntry.Name: Line0FallingEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when a Falling Edge is detected on the Line 0.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when a Falling Edge is detected on the Line 0.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1FallingEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when a Falling Edge is detected on the Line 1.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when a Falling Edge is detected on the Line 1.

EnumEntry.Name: Line0AnyEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when a Falling or Rising Edge is detected on the Line 0.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when a Falling or Rising Edge is detected on the Line 0.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1AnyEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when a Falling or Rising Edge is detected on the Line 1.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when a Falling or Rising Edge is detected on the Line 1.

EnumEntry.Name: LinkTrigger0
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when a Rising Edge is detected on the LinkTrigger 0.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when a Rising Edge is detected on the LinkTrigger 0.

EnumEntry.Name: LinkTrigger1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when a Rising Edge is detected on the LinkTrigger 1.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when a Rising Edge is detected on the LinkTrigger 1.

EnumEntry.Name: LinkSpeedChange
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when the link speed has changed.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when the link speed has changed.

EnumEntry.Name: ActionLate
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when a valid scheduled action command is received and is scheduled to be executed at a time that is already past.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when a valid scheduled action command is received and is scheduled to be executed at a time that is already past.

EnumEntry.Name: Error
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just detected an error during the active Acquisition.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just detected an error during the active Acquisition.

EnumEntry.Name: Test
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The test event will be generated when the device receives the TestEventGenerate command (EventNotification for the Test event is always On).
EnumEntry.Description: The test event will be generated when the device receives the TestEventGenerate command (EventNotification for the Test event is always On).

EnumEntry.Name: PrimaryApplicationSwitch
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when a primary application switchover has been granted (GigE Vision Specific).
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when a primary application switchover has been granted (GigE Vision Specific).

Enumeration.Name: EventNotification
Enumeration.ToolTip: Activate or deactivate the notification to the host application of the occurrence of the selected Event.
Enumeration.Description: Activate or deactivate the notification to the host application of the occurrence of the selected Event.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The selected Event notification is disabled.
EnumEntry.Description: The selected Event notification is disabled.

EnumEntry.Name: On
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The selected Event notification is enabled.
EnumEntry.Description: The selected Event notification is enabled.

EnumEntry.Name: Once
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The selected Event notification is enabled for one event then return to Off state.
EnumEntry.Description: The selected Event notification is enabled for one event then return to Off state.

Integer.Name: EventError
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique identifier of the Error type of Event.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique identifier of the Error type of Event. It can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the Error event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies that the event received was an Error.

Integer.Name: EventErrorTimestamp
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the Timestamp of the Error Event.
Integer.Description: Returns the Timestamp of the Error Event. It can be used to determine when the event occurred.

Integer.Name: EventErrorFrameID
Integer.ToolTip: If applicable, returns the unique Identifier of the Frame (or image) that generated the Error Event.
Integer.Description: If applicable, returns the unique Identifier of the Frame (or image) that generated the Error Event.

Integer.Name: EventErrorCode
Integer.ToolTip: Returns an error code for the error(s) that happened.
Integer.Description: Returns an error code for the error(s) that happened.

Integer.Name: EventTest
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique identifier of the Event Test type of event generated using the TestEventGenerate command.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique identifier of the Event Test type of event generated using the TestEventGenerate command. It can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the EventTest event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies that the event received was an Event Test.

Integer.Name: EventTestTimestamp
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the Timestamp of the Event Test event.
Integer.Description: Returns the Timestamp of the Event Test event. It can be used to determine when the event occurred.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the feature User Set to load, save or configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the feature User Set to load, save or configure.

EnumEntry.Name: Default
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the factory setting user set.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects the factory setting user set.

Command.Name: UserSetLoad
Command.ToolTip: Loads the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the device and makes it active.
Command.Description: Loads the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the device and makes it active.

Command.Name: UserSetSave
Command.ToolTip: Save the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the non-volatile memory of the device.
Command.Description: Save the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the non-volatile memory of the device.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetDefault
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the feature User Set to load and make active by default when the device is reset.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the feature User Set to load and make active by default when the device is reset.

EnumEntry.Name: Default
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Select the factory setting user set.
EnumEntry.Description: Select the factory setting user set.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetFeatureSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which individual UserSet feature to control.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which individual UserSet feature to control.

Boolean.Name: UserSetFeatureEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the selected feature and make it active in all the UserSets.
Boolean.Description: Enables the selected feature and make it active in all the UserSets.

Enumeration.Name: SequencerMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls if the sequencer mechanism is active.
Enumeration.Description: Controls if the sequencer mechanism is active.

Enumeration.Name: SequencerConfigurationMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls if the sequencer configuration mode is active.
Enumeration.Description: Controls if the sequencer configuration mode is active.

Enumeration.Name: SequencerFeatureSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which sequencer features to control.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which sequencer features to control.

Boolean.Name: SequencerFeatureEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the selected feature and make it active in all the sequencer sets.
Boolean.Description: Enables the selected feature and make it active in all the sequencer sets.

Integer.Name: SequencerSetSelector
Integer.ToolTip: Selects the sequencer set to which further feature settings applies.
Integer.Description: Selects the sequencer set to which further feature settings applies.

Command.Name: SequencerSetSave
Command.ToolTip: Saves the current device state to the sequencer set selected by the SequencerSetSelector.
Command.Description: Saves the current device state to the sequencer set selected by the SequencerSetSelector.

Command.Name: SequencerSetLoad
Command.ToolTip: Loads the sequencer set selected by SequencerSetSelector in the device.
Command.Description: Loads the sequencer set selected by SequencerSetSelector in the device. Even if SequencerMode is off, this will change the device state to the configuration of the selected set.

Integer.Name: SequencerSetActive
Integer.ToolTip: Contains the currently active sequencer set.
Integer.Description: Contains the currently active sequencer set.

Integer.Name: SequencerSetStart
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the initial/start sequencer set, which is the first set used within a sequencer.
Integer.Description: Sets the initial/start sequencer set, which is the first set used within a sequencer.

Integer.Name: SequencerPathSelector
Integer.ToolTip: Selects to which branching path further path settings applies.
Integer.Description: Selects to which branching path further path settings applies.

Integer.Name: SequencerSetNext
Integer.ToolTip: Specifies the next sequencer set.
Integer.Description: Specifies the next sequencer set.

Enumeration.Name: SequencerTriggerSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the internal signal or physical input line to use as the sequencer trigger source.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the internal signal or physical input line to use as the sequencer trigger source.

EnumEntry.Name: CC1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Index of the Camera Link physical line and associated I/O control block to use.
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the Camera Link physical line and associated I/O control block to use. This ensures a direct mapping between the lines on the frame grabber and on the camera. Applicable to CameraLink products only.

EnumEntry.ToolTip: Index of the Camera Link physical line and associated I/O control block to use.

Enumeration.Name: SequencerTriggerActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the activation mode of the sequencer trigger.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the activation mode of the sequencer trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: RisingEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the rising edge of the source signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the rising edge of the source signal.

EnumEntry.Name: FallingEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling edge of the source signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling edge of the source signal.

EnumEntry.Name: AnyEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling or rising edge of the source signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling or rising edge of the source signal.

EnumEntry.Name: LevelHigh
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid as long as the level of the source signal is high.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid as long as the level of the source signal is high.

EnumEntry.Name: LevelLow
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid as long as the level of the source signal is low.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid as long as the level of the source signal is low.

Enumeration.Name: FileSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the target file in the device.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the target file in the device.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSetDefault
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The default user set of the device.
EnumEntry.Description: The default user set of the device.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The first user set of the device.
EnumEntry.Description: The first user set of the device.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The second user set of the device.
EnumEntry.Description: The second user set of the device.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet3
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The third user set of the device.
EnumEntry.Description: The third user set of the device.

EnumEntry.Name: LUTLuminance
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The Luminance LUT of the camera.
EnumEntry.Description: The Luminance LUT of the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: LUTRed
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The Red LUT of the camera.
EnumEntry.Description: The Red LUT of the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: LUTGreen
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The Green LUT of the camera.
EnumEntry.Description: The Green LUT of the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: LUTBlue
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The Blue LUT of the camera.
EnumEntry.Description: The Blue LUT of the camera.

Enumeration.Name: FileOperationSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the target operation for the selected file in the device.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the target operation for the selected file in the device. This Operation is executed when the FileOperationExecute feature is called.

EnumEntry.Name: Open
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Opens the file selected by FileSelector in the device.
EnumEntry.Description: Opens the file selected by FileSelector in the device. The access mode in which the file is opened is selected by FileOpenMode.

EnumEntry.Name: Close
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Closes the file selected by FileSelector in the device.
EnumEntry.Description: Closes the file selected by FileSelector in the device.

EnumEntry.Name: Read
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Reads FileAccessLength bytes from the device storage at the file relative offset FileAccessOffset into FileAccessBuffer.
EnumEntry.Description: Reads FileAccessLength bytes from the device storage at the file relative offset FileAccessOffset into FileAccessBuffer.

EnumEntry.Name: Write
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Writes FileAccessLength bytes taken from the FileAccessBuffer into the device storage at the file relative offset FileAccessOffset.
EnumEntry.Description: Writes FileAccessLength bytes taken from the FileAccessBuffer into the device storage at the file relative offset FileAccessOffset.

EnumEntry.Name: Delete
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Deletes the file selected by FileSelector in the device.
EnumEntry.Description: Deletes the file selected by FileSelector in the device. Note that deleting a device file should not remove the associated FileSelector entry to allow future operation on this file.

Command.Name: FileOperationExecute
Command.ToolTip: Executes the operation selected by FileOperationSelector on the selected file.
Command.Description: Executes the operation selected by FileOperationSelector on the selected file.

Enumeration.Name: FileOpenMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the access mode in which a file is opened in the device.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the access mode in which a file is opened in the device.

EnumEntry.Name: Read
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This mode selects read-only open mode.
EnumEntry.Description: This mode selects read-only open mode.

EnumEntry.Name: Write
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This mode selects write-only open mode.
EnumEntry.Description: This mode selects write-only open mode.

EnumEntry.Name: ReadWrite
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This mode selects read and write open mode.
EnumEntry.Description: This mode selects read and write open mode.

Register.Name: FileAccessBuffer
Register.ToolTip: Defines the intermediate access buffer that allows the exchange of data between the device file storage and the application.
Register.Description: Defines the intermediate access buffer that allows the exchange of data between the device file storage and the application.

Integer.Name: FileAccessOffset
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the Offset of the mapping between the device file storage and the FileAccessBuffer.
Integer.Description: Controls the Offset of the mapping between the device file storage and the FileAccessBuffer.

Integer.Name: FileAccessLength
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the Length of the mapping between the device file storage and the FileAccessBuffer.
Integer.Description: Controls the Length of the mapping between the device file storage and the FileAccessBuffer.

Enumeration.Name: FileOperationStatus
Enumeration.ToolTip: Represents the file operation execution status.
Enumeration.Description: Represents the file operation execution status.

Integer.Name: FileOperationResult
Integer.ToolTip: Represents the file operation result.
Integer.Description: Represents the file operation result. For Read or Write operations, the number of successfully read/written bytes is returned.

Integer.Name: FileSize
Integer.ToolTip: Represents the size of the selected file in bytes.
Integer.Description: Represents the size of the selected file in bytes.

Integer.Name: SourceCount
Integer.ToolTip: Controls or returns the number of sources supported by the device.
Integer.Description: Controls or returns the number of sources supported by the device.

Enumeration.Name: SourceSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the source to control.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the source to control.

Integer.Name: SourceIDValue
Integer.ToolTip: Returns a unique Identifier value that correspond to the selected Source.
Integer.Description: Returns a unique Identifier value that correspond to the selected Source.

Enumeration.Name: TransferSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which stream transfers are currently controlled by the selected Transfer features.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which stream transfers are currently controlled by the selected Transfer features.

EnumEntry.Name: Stream0
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The transfer features control the data stream 0.
EnumEntry.Description: The transfer features control the data stream 0.

EnumEntry.Name: Stream1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The transfer features control the data stream 1.
EnumEntry.Description: The transfer features control the data stream 1.

EnumEntry.Name: Stream2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The transfer features control the data stream 2.
EnumEntry.Description: The transfer features control the data stream 2.

EnumEntry.Name: All
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The transfer features control all the data streams simultaneously.
EnumEntry.Description: The transfer features control all the data streams simultaneously.

Enumeration.Name: TransferControlMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the control method for the transfers.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the control method for the transfers.

Enumeration.Name: TransferOperationMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the operation mode of the transfer.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the operation mode of the transfer.

Integer.Name: TransferBlockCount
Integer.ToolTip: Specifies the number of data Blocks that the device should stream before stopping.
Integer.Description: Specifies the number of data Blocks that the device should stream before stopping. This feature is only active if the TransferOperationMode is set to MultiBlock.

Integer.Name: TransferBurstCount
Integer.ToolTip: Number of Block(s) to transfer for each TransferBurstStart trigger.
Integer.Description: Number of Block(s) to transfer for each TransferBurstStart trigger.

Integer.Name: TransferQueueMaxBlockCount
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the maximum number of data blocks that can be stored in the block queue of the selected stream.
Integer.Description: Controls the maximum number of data blocks that can be stored in the block queue of the selected stream.

Integer.Name: TransferQueueCurrentBlockCount
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the number of Block(s) currently in the transfer queue.
Integer.Description: Returns the number of Block(s) currently in the transfer queue.

Enumeration.Name: TransferQueueMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the operation mode of the transfer queue.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the operation mode of the transfer queue.

EnumEntry.Name: FirstInFirstOut
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Blocks first In are transferred Out first.
EnumEntry.Description: Blocks first In are transferred Out first.

Command.Name: TransferStart
Command.ToolTip: Starts the streaming of data blocks out of the device.
Command.Description: Starts the streaming of data blocks out of the device. This feature must be available when the TransferControlMode is set to "UserControlled". If the TransferStart feature is not writable (locked), the application should not start the transfer and should avoid using the feature until it becomes writable again.

Command.Name: TransferStop
Command.ToolTip: Stops the streaming of data Block(s).
Command.Description: Stops the streaming of data Block(s). The current block transmission will be completed. This feature must be available when the TransferControlMode is set to "UserControlled".

Command.Name: TransferAbort
Command.ToolTip: Aborts immediately the streaming of data block(s).
Command.Description: Aborts immediately the streaming of data block(s). Aborting the transfer will result in the lost of the data that is present or currently entering in the block queue. However, the next new block received will be stored in the queue and transferred to the host when the streaming is restarted. If implemented, this feature should be available when the TransferControlMode is set to "UserControlled".

Command.Name: TransferPause
Command.ToolTip: Pauses the streaming of data Block(s).
Command.Description: Pauses the streaming of data Block(s). Pausing the streaming will immediately suspend the ongoing data transfer even if a block is partially transfered. The device will resume its transmission at the reception of a TransferResume command.

Command.Name: TransferResume
Command.ToolTip: Resumes a data Blocks streaming that was previously paused by a TransferPause command.
Command.Description: Resumes a data Blocks streaming that was previously paused by a TransferPause command.

Enumeration.Name: TransferTriggerSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the type of transfer trigger to configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the type of transfer trigger to configure.

EnumEntry.Name: TransferStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger to start the transfers.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger to start the transfers.

EnumEntry.Name: TransferStop
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger to stop the transfers.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger to stop the transfers.

EnumEntry.Name: TransferAbort
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger to abort the transfers.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger to abort the transfers.

EnumEntry.Name: TransferPause
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger to pause the transfers.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger to pause the transfers.

EnumEntry.Name: TransferResume
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger to Resume the transfers.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger to Resume the transfers.

EnumEntry.Name: TransferActive
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger to Activate the transfers.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger to Activate the transfers. This trigger type is used when TriggerActivation is set LevelHigh or levelLow.

EnumEntry.Name: TransferBurstStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger to start the transfer of a burst of frames specified by TransferBurstCount.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger to start the transfer of a burst of frames specified by TransferBurstCount.

EnumEntry.Name: TransferBurstStop
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger to end the transfer of a burst of frames.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger to end the transfer of a burst of frames.

Enumeration.Name: TransferTriggerMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls if the selected trigger is active.
Enumeration.Description: Controls if the selected trigger is active.

Enumeration.Name: TransferTriggerSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the signal to use as the trigger source for transfers.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the signal to use as the trigger source for transfers.

EnumEntry.Name: Line0
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which physical line (or pin) and associated I/O control block to use as external source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which physical line (or pin) and associated I/O control block to use as external source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which physical line (or pin) and associated I/O control block to use as external source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which physical line (or pin) and associated I/O control block to use as external source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Line2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which physical line (or pin) and associated I/O control block to use as external source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which physical line (or pin) and associated I/O control block to use as external source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter0Start
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1Start
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter2Start
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter0End
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1End
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter2End
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer0Start
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1Start
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer2Start
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer0End
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1End
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer2End
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: LogicBlock0
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Logic Block to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Logic Block to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: LogicBlock1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Logic Block to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Logic Block to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: LogicBlock2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Logic Block to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Logic Block to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: SoftwareSignal0
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Software Signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Software Signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: SoftwareSignal1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Software Signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Software Signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: SoftwareSignal2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Software Signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Software Signal to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Action0
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Action command to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Action command to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Action1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Action command to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Action command to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Action2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Action command to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Action command to use as internal source for the transfer control trigger signal.

Enumeration.Name: TransferTriggerActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the activation mode of the transfer control trigger.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the activation mode of the transfer control trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: RisingEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the rising edge of the source signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the rising edge of the source signal.

EnumEntry.Name: FallingEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling edge of the source signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling edge of the source signal.

EnumEntry.Name: AnyEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling or rising edge of the source signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling or rising edge of the source signal.

EnumEntry.Name: LevelHigh
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid as long as the level of the source signal is high.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid as long as the level of the source signal is high. This can apply to TransferActive and TransferPause trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: LevelLow
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid as long as the level of the source signal is low.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid as long as the level of the source signal is low. This can apply to TransferActive and TransferPause trigger.

Enumeration.Name: TransferStatusSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which status of the transfer module to read.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which status of the transfer module to read.

EnumEntry.Name: Streaming
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Data blocks are transmitted when enough data is available.
EnumEntry.Description: Data blocks are transmitted when enough data is available.

EnumEntry.Name: Paused
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Data blocks transmission is suspended immediately.
EnumEntry.Description: Data blocks transmission is suspended immediately.

EnumEntry.Name: Stopping
EnumEntry.Description: Data blocks transmission is stopping. The current block transmission will be completed and the transfer state will stop.

EnumEntry.Name: QueueOverflow
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Data blocks queue is in overflow state.
EnumEntry.Description: Data blocks queue is in overflow state.

Boolean.Name: TransferStatus
Boolean.ToolTip: Reads the status of the Transfer module signal selected by TransferStatusSelector.
Boolean.Description: Reads the status of the Transfer module signal selected by TransferStatusSelector.

Enumeration.Name: TransferComponentSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the color component for the control of the TransferStreamChannel feature.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the color component for the control of the TransferStreamChannel feature.

EnumEntry.Name: Red
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The TransferStreamChannel feature controls the index of the stream channel for the streaming of the red plane of the planar pixel formats.
EnumEntry.Description: The TransferStreamChannel feature controls the index of the stream channel for the streaming of the red plane of the planar pixel formats.

EnumEntry.Name: Green
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The TransferStreamChannel feature controls the index of the stream channel for the streaming of the green plane of the planar pixel formats.
EnumEntry.Description: The TransferStreamChannel feature controls the index of the stream channel for the streaming of the green plane of the planar pixel formats.

EnumEntry.Name: Blue
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The TransferStreamChannel feature controls the index of the stream channel for the streaming of blue plane of the planar pixel formats.
EnumEntry.Description: The TransferStreamChannel feature controls the index of the stream channel for the streaming of blue plane of the planar pixel formats.

EnumEntry.Name: All
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The TransferStreamChannel feature controls the index of the stream channel for the streaming of all the planes of the planar pixel formats simultaneously or non planar pixel formats.
EnumEntry.Description: The TransferStreamChannel feature controls the index of the stream channel for the streaming of all the planes of the planar pixel formats simultaneously or non planar pixel formats.

Integer.Name: TransferStreamChannel
Integer.ToolTip: Selects the streaming channel that will be used to transfer the selected stream of data.
Integer.Description: Selects the streaming channel that will be used to transfer the selected stream of data. In general, this feature can be omitted and the default streaming channel will be used.

Enumeration.Name: Scan3dExtractionSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the 3DExtraction processing module to control (if multiple ones are present).
Enumeration.Description: Selects the 3DExtraction processing module to control (if multiple ones are present).

Enumeration.Name: Scan3dExtractionSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the sensor's data source region for 3D Extraction module.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the sensor's data source region for 3D Extraction module.

Enumeration.Name: Scan3dExtractionMethod
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the method for extracting 3D from the input sensor data.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the method for extracting 3D from the input sensor data.

EnumEntry.Name: Default
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Default range extraction method for the device.
EnumEntry.Description: Default range extraction method for the device.

Enumeration.Name: Scan3dDistanceUnit
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the unit used when delivering (calibrated) distance data.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the unit used when delivering (calibrated) distance data.

EnumEntry.Name: Millimeter
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Distance values are in millimeter units (default).
EnumEntry.Description: Distance values are in millimeter units (default).

EnumEntry.Name: Meter
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Distance values are in meter units.
EnumEntry.Description: Distance values are in meter units.

EnumEntry.Name: Inch
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Distance values are in inch units.
EnumEntry.Description: Distance values are in inch units.

EnumEntry.Name: Pixel
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Distance values are given as a multiple of the size of a pixel.
EnumEntry.Description: Distance values are given as a multiple of the size of a pixel.

Enumeration.Name: Scan3dCoordinateSystem
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the Coordinate system to use for the device.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the Coordinate system to use for the device.

Enumeration.Name: Scan3dOutputMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the Calibration and data organization of the device and the coordinates transmitted.
Enumeration.Description: Controls the Calibration and data organization of the device and the coordinates transmitted.

EnumEntry.Name: UncalibratedC
EnumEntry.Description: Uncalibrated 2.5D Depth map. The distance data does not represent a physical unit and may be non-linear. The data is a 2.5D range map only.

EnumEntry.Name: CalibratedABC_Grid
EnumEntry.Description: 3 Coordinates in grid organization. The full 3 coordinate data with the grid array organization from the sensor kept.

EnumEntry.Name: CalibratedABC_PointCloud
EnumEntry.Description: 3 Coordinates without organization. The full 3 coordinate data without any organization of data points. Typically only valid points transmitted giving varying image size.

EnumEntry.Name: CalibratedAC
EnumEntry.Description: 2 Coordinates with fixed B sampling. The data is sent as a A and C coordinates (X,Z or Theta,Rho). The B (Y) axis uses the scale and offset parameters for the B axis.

EnumEntry.Name: CalibratedAC_Linescan
EnumEntry.Description: 2 Coordinates with varying sampling. The data is sent as a A and C coordinates (X,Z or Theta,Rho). The B (Y) axis comes from the encoder chunk value.

EnumEntry.Name: CalibratedC
EnumEntry.Description: Calibrated 2.5D Depth map. The distance data is expressed in the chosen distance unit. The data is a 2.5D range map. No information on X-Y axes available.

EnumEntry.Name: CalibratedC_Linescan
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Depth Map with varying B sampling.
EnumEntry.Description: Depth Map with varying B sampling. The distance data is expressed in the chosen distance unit. The data is a 2.5D range map. The B (Y) axis comes from the encoder chunk value.

EnumEntry.Name: RectifiedC
EnumEntry.Description: Rectified 2.5D Depth map. The distance data has been rectified to a uniform sampling pattern in the X and Y direction. The data is a 2.5D range map only. If a complete 3D point cloud is rectified but transmitted as explicit coordinates it should be transmitted as one of the "CalibratedABC" formats.

EnumEntry.Name: RectifiedC_Linescan
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Rectified 2.5D Depth map with varying B sampling.
EnumEntry.Description: Rectified 2.5D Depth map with varying B sampling. The data is sent as rectified 1D profiles using Coord3D_C pixels. The B (Y) axis comes from the encoder chunk value.

EnumEntry.Name: DisparityC
EnumEntry.Description: Disparity 2.5D Depth map. The distance is inversely proportional to the pixel (disparity) value.

EnumEntry.Name: DisparityC_Linescan
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Disparity 2.5D Depth map with varying B sampling.
EnumEntry.Description: Disparity 2.5D Depth map with varying B sampling. The distance is inversely proportional to the pixel (disparity) value. The B (Y) axis comes from the encoder chunk value.

Enumeration.Name: Scan3dCoordinateSystemReference
Enumeration.ToolTip: Defines coordinate system reference location.
Enumeration.Description: Defines coordinate system reference location.

EnumEntry.Name: Anchor
EnumEntry.Description: Default value. Original fixed reference. The coordinate system fixed relative the camera reference point marker is used.

EnumEntry.Name: Transformed
EnumEntry.Description: Transformed reference system. The transformed coordinate system is used according to the definition in the rotation and translation matrices.

Enumeration.Name: Scan3dCoordinateSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the individual coordinates in the vectors for 3D information/transformation.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the individual coordinates in the vectors for 3D information/transformation.

Float.Name: Scan3dCoordinateScale
Float.ToolTip: Scale factor when transforming a pixel from relative coordinates to world coordinates.
Float.Description: Scale factor when transforming a pixel from relative coordinates to world coordinates.

Float.Name: Scan3dCoordinateOffset
Float.ToolTip: Offset when transforming a pixel from relative coordinates to world coordinates.
Float.Description: Offset when transforming a pixel from relative coordinates to world coordinates.

Boolean.Name: Scan3dInvalidDataFlag
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the definition of a non-valid flag value in the data stream.
Boolean.Description: Enables the definition of a non-valid flag value in the data stream. Note that the confidence output is an alternate recommended way to identify non-valid pixels. Using a Scan3dInvalidDataValue may give processing penalties due to special handling.

Float.Name: Scan3dInvalidDataValue
Float.ToolTip: Value which identifies a non-valid pixel if Scan3dInvalidDataFlag is enabled.
Float.Description: Value which identifies a non-valid pixel if Scan3dInvalidDataFlag is enabled.

Float.Name: Scan3dAxisMin
Float.ToolTip: Minimum valid transmitted coordinate value of the selected Axis.
Float.Description: Minimum valid transmitted coordinate value of the selected Axis.

Float.Name: Scan3dAxisMax
Float.ToolTip: Maximum valid transmitted coordinate value of the selected Axis.
Float.Description: Maximum valid transmitted coordinate value of the selected Axis.

Enumeration.Name: Scan3dCoordinateTransformSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the index to read/write a coordinate transform value.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the index to read/write a coordinate transform value.

Float.Name: Scan3dTransformValue
Float.ToolTip: Specifies the transform value selected.
Float.Description: Specifies the transform value selected. For translations (Scan3dCoordinateTransformSelector = TranslationX/Y/Z) it is expressed in the distance unit of the system, for rotations (Scan3dCoordinateTransformSelector =RotationX/Y/Z) in degrees.

Enumeration.Name: Scan3dCoordinateReferenceSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the index to read a coordinate system reference value defining the transform of a point from the current (Anchor or Transformed) system to the reference system.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the index to read a coordinate system reference value defining the transform of a point from the current (Anchor or Transformed) system to the reference system.

Float.Name: Scan3dCoordinateReferenceValue
Float.ToolTip: Returns the reference value selected.
Float.Description: Returns the reference value selected. Reads the value of a rotation or translation value for the current (Anchor or Transformed) coordinate system transformation to the Reference system.

Float.Name: Scan3dFocalLength
Float.ToolTip: Returns the focal length of the camera in pixel.
Float.Description: Returns the focal length of the camera in pixel. The focal length depends on the selected region. The value of this feature takes into account horizontal binning, decimation, or any other function changing the image resolution.

Float.Name: Scan3dBaseline
Float.ToolTip: Returns the baseline as the physical distance of two cameras in a stereo camera setup.
Float.Description: Returns the baseline as the physical distance of two cameras in a stereo camera setup. The value of this feature can be used for 3D reconstruction from disparity images. In this case, the unit of the 3D coordinates corresponds to the unit of the baseline.

Float.Name: Scan3dPrincipalPointU
Float.ToolTip: Returns the value of the horizontal position of the principal point, relative to the region origin, i.e.
Float.Description: Returns the value of the horizontal position of the principal point, relative to the region origin, i.e. OffsetX. The value of this feature takes into account horizontal binning, decimation, or any other function changing the image resolution.

Float.Name: Scan3dPrincipalPointV
Float.ToolTip: Returns the value of the vertical position of the principal point, relative to the region origin, i.e.
Float.Description: Returns the value of the vertical position of the principal point, relative to the region origin, i.e. OffsetY. The value of this feature takes into account vertical binning, decimation, or any other function changing the image resolution.

Enumeration.Name: LightControllerSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the Light Controller to configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the Light Controller to configure.

Enumeration.Name: LightControllerSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the input source signal of the Light Controller.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the input source signal of the Light Controller.

Float.Name: LightCurrentRating

Integer.Description: Returns the unique integer Identifier value of the Source that the image comes from.

Integer.Name: ChunkTransferQueueCurrentBlockCount
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the current number of blocks in the transfer queue.
Integer.Description: Returns the current number of blocks in the transfer queue.
Integer.DisplayName: Chunk Transfer Queue Current Block Count

Integer.Name: ChunkStreamChannelID
